member.summary: Flush the stream.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefStreamWriter.MayBlock
member.summary: Returns true if this writer performs work like accessing the file system which may block. Used as a hint for determining the thread to access the writer from.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefStringVisitor
member.summary: Implement this interface to receive string values asynchronously.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefStringVisitor.Visit(System.String)
member.summary: Method that will be executed.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTask
member.summary: Implement this interface for asynchronous task execution. If the task is posted successfully and if the associated message loop is still running then the Execute() method will be called on the target thread. If the task fails to post then the task object may be destroyed on the source thread instead of the target thread. For this reason be cautious when performing work in the task object destructor.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTask.Execute
member.summary: Method that will be executed on the target thread.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner
member.summary: Class that asynchronously executes tasks on the associated thread. It is safe to call the methods of this class on any thread. CEF maintains multiple internal threads that are used for handling different types of tasks in different processes. The cef_thread_id_t definitions in cef_types.h list the common CEF threads. Task runners are also available for other CEF threads as appropriate (for example, V8 WebWorker threads).

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.GetForCurrentThread
member.summary: Returns the task runner for the current thread. Only CEF threads will have task runners. An empty reference will be returned if this method is called on an invalid thread.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.GetForThread(Xilium.CefGlue.CefThreadId)
member.summary: Returns the task runner for the specified CEF thread.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.IsSame(Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner)
member.summary: Returns true if this object is pointing to the same task runner as |that| object.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.BelongsToCurrentThread
member.summary: Returns true if this task runner belongs to the current thread.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.BelongsToThread(Xilium.CefGlue.CefThreadId)
member.summary: Returns true if this task runner is for the specified CEF thread.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.PostTask(Xilium.CefGlue.CefTask)
member.summary: Post a task for execution on the thread associated with this task runner. Execution will occur asynchronously.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner.PostDelayedTask(Xilium.CefGlue.CefTask,System.Int64)
member.summary: Post a task for delayed execution on the thread associated with this task runner. Execution will occur asynchronously. Delayed tasks are not supported on V8 WebWorker threads and will be executed without the specified delay.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest
member.summary: Class used to make a URL request. URL requests are not associated with a browser instance so no CefClient callbacks will be executed. URL requests can be created on any valid CEF thread in either the browser or render process. Once created the methods of the URL request object must be accessed on the same thread that created it.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.Create(Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient,Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext)
member.summary: Create a new URL request. Only GET, POST, HEAD, DELETE and PUT request methods are supported. Multiple post data elements are not supported and elements of type PDE_TYPE_FILE are only supported for requests originating from the browser process. Requests originating from the render process will receive the same handling as requests originating from Web content -- if the response contains Content-Disposition or Mime-Type header values that would not normally be rendered then the response may receive special handling inside the browser (for example, via the file download code path instead of the URL request code path). The |request| object will be marked as read-only after calling this method. In the browser process if |request_context| is empty the global request context will be used. In the render process |request_context| must be empty and the context associated with the current renderer process' browser will be used.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.GetRequest
member.summary: Returns the request object used to create this URL request. The returned object is read-only and should not be modified.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.GetClient
member.summary: Returns the client.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.RequestStatus
member.summary: Returns the request status.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.RequestError
member.summary: Returns the request error if status is UR_CANCELED or UR_FAILED, or 0 otherwise.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.GetResponse
member.summary: Returns the response, or NULL if no response information is available. Response information will only be available after the upload has completed. The returned object is read-only and should not be modified.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.ResponseWasCached
member.summary: Returns true if the response body was served from the cache. This includes responses for which revalidation was required.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the request.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented by the CefURLRequest client. The methods of this class will be called on the same thread that created the request unless otherwise documented.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnRequestComplete(Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest)
member.summary: Notifies the client that the request has completed. Use the CefURLRequest::GetRequestStatus method to determine if the request was successful or not.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnUploadProgress(Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Notifies the client of upload progress. |current| denotes the number of bytes sent so far and |total| is the total size of uploading data (or -1 if chunked upload is enabled). This method will only be called if the UR_FLAG_REPORT_UPLOAD_PROGRESS flag is set on the request.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnDownloadProgress(Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Notifies the client of download progress. |current| denotes the number of bytes received up to the call and |total| is the expected total size of the response (or -1 if not determined).

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnDownloadData(Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Called when some part of the response is read. |data| contains the current bytes received since the last call. This method will not be called if the UR_FLAG_NO_DOWNLOAD_DATA flag is set on the request.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.GetAuthCredentials(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefAuthCallback)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when the browser needs credentials from the user. |isProxy| indicates whether the host is a proxy server. |host| contains the hostname and |port| contains the port number. Return true to continue the request and call CefAuthCallback::Continue() when the authentication information is available. Return false to cancel the request. This method will only be called for requests initiated from the browser process.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Accessor
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented to handle V8 function calls. The methods of this class will be called on the thread associated with the V8 function.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Accessor.Get(System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle retrieval the accessor value identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the accessor. If retrieval succeeds set |retval| to the return value. If retrieval fails set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if accessor retrieval was handled.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Accessor.Set(System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle assignment of the accessor value identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the accessor. |value| is the new value being assigned to the accessor. If assignment fails set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if accessor assignment was handled.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8ArrayBufferReleaseCallback
member.summary: Callback interface that is passed to CefV8Value::CreateArrayBuffer.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8ArrayBufferReleaseCallback.ReleaseBuffer(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called to release |buffer| when the ArrayBuffer JS object is garbage collected. |buffer| is the value that was passed to CreateArrayBuffer along with this object.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context
member.summary: Class representing a V8 context handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetCurrentContext
member.summary: Returns the current (top) context object in the V8 context stack.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetEnteredContext
member.summary: Returns the entered (bottom) context object in the V8 context stack.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.InContext
member.summary: Returns true if V8 is currently inside a context.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetTaskRunner
member.summary: Returns the task runner associated with this context. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. This method can be called on any render process thread.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying handle is valid and it can be accessed on the current thread. Do not call any other methods if this method returns false.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetBrowser
member.summary: Returns the browser for this context. This method will return an empty reference for WebWorker contexts.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetFrame
member.summary: Returns the frame for this context. This method will return an empty reference for WebWorker contexts.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetGlobal
member.summary: Returns the global object for this context. The context must be entered before calling this method.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.Enter
member.summary: Enter this context. A context must be explicitly entered before creating a V8 Object, Array, Function or Date asynchronously. Exit() must be called the same number of times as Enter() before releasing this context. V8 objects belong to the context in which they are created. Returns true if the scope was entered successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.Exit
member.summary: Exit this context. Call this method only after calling Enter(). Returns true if the scope was exited successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.IsSame(Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context)
member.summary: Returns true if this object is pointing to the same handle as |that| object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.TryEval(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception@)
member.summary: Execute a string of JavaScript code in this V8 context. The |script_url| parameter is the URL where the script in question can be found, if any. The |start_line| parameter is the base line number to use for error reporting. On success |retval| will be set to the return value, if any, and the function will return true. On failure |exception| will be set to the exception, if any, and the function will return false.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception
member.summary: Class representing a V8 exception. The methods of this class may be called on any render process thread.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.Message
member.summary: Returns the exception message.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.SourceLine
member.summary: Returns the line of source code that the exception occurred within.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.ScriptResourceName
member.summary: Returns the resource name for the script from where the function causing the error originates.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.LineNumber
member.summary: Returns the 1-based number of the line where the error occurred or 0 if the line number is unknown.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.StartPosition
member.summary: Returns the index within the script of the first character where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.EndPosition
member.summary: Returns the index within the script of the last character where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.StartColumn
member.summary: Returns the index within the line of the first character where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.EndColumn
member.summary: Returns the index within the line of the last character where the error occurred.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Handler
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented to handle V8 function calls. The methods of this class will always be called on the render process main thread.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Handler.Execute(System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value[],Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle execution of the function identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the function. |arguments| is the list of arguments passed to the function. If execution succeeds set |retval| to the function return value. If execution fails set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if execution was handled.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Interceptor
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented to handle V8 interceptor calls. The methods of this class will be called on the thread associated with the V8 interceptor. Interceptor's named property handlers (with first argument of type CefString) are called when object is indexed by string. Indexed property handlers (with first argument of type int) are called when object is indexed by integer.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Interceptor.GetByName(System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle retrieval of the interceptor value identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the interceptor. If retrieval succeeds, set |retval| to the return value. If the requested value does not exist, don't set either |retval| or |exception|. If retrieval fails, set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. If the property has an associated accessor, it will be called only if you don't set |retval|. Return true if interceptor retrieval was handled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Interceptor.GetByIndex(System.Int32,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle retrieval of the interceptor value identified by |index|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the interceptor. If retrieval succeeds, set |retval| to the return value. If the requested value does not exist, don't set either |retval| or |exception|. If retrieval fails, set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if interceptor retrieval was handled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Interceptor.SetByName(System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle assignment of the interceptor value identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the interceptor. |value| is the new value being assigned to the interceptor. If assignment fails, set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. This setter will always be called, even when the property has an associated accessor. Return true if interceptor assignment was handled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Interceptor.SetByIndex(System.Int32,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle assignment of the interceptor value identified by |index|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the interceptor. |value| is the new value being assigned to the interceptor. If assignment fails, set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if interceptor assignment was handled, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame
member.summary: Class representing a V8 stack frame handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying handle is valid and it can be accessed on the current thread. Do not call any other methods if this method returns false.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.ScriptName
member.summary: Returns the name of the resource script that contains the function.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.ScriptNameOrSourceUrl
member.summary: Returns the name of the resource script that contains the function or the sourceURL value if the script name is undefined and its source ends with a "//@ sourceURL=..." string.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.FunctionName
member.summary: Returns the name of the function.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.LineNumber
member.summary: Returns the 1-based line number for the function call or 0 if unknown.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.Column
member.summary: Returns the 1-based column offset on the line for the function call or 0 if unknown.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.IsEval
member.summary: Returns true if the function was compiled using eval().

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.IsConstructor
member.summary: Returns true if the function was called as a constructor via "new".

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace
member.summary: Class representing a V8 stack trace handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.GetCurrent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the stack trace for the currently active context. |frame_limit| is the maximum number of frames that will be captured.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying handle is valid and it can be accessed on the current thread. Do not call any other methods if this method returns false.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.FrameCount
member.summary: Returns the number of stack frames.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.GetFrame(System.Int32)

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value
member.summary: Class representing a V8 value handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. member.summary: Create a new CefV8Value object of type array with the specified |length|. If |length| is negative the returned array will have length 0. member.summary: Create a new CefV8Value object of type ArrayBuffer which wraps the provided |buffer| of size |length| bytes. The ArrayBuffer is externalized, meaning that it does not own |buffer|. The caller is responsible for freeing |buffer| when requested via a call to CefV8ArrayBufferReleaseCallback:: ReleaseBuffer. This method should only be called from within the scope of a CefRenderProcessHandler, CefV8Handler or CefV8Accessor callback, or in combination with calling Enter() and Exit() on a stored CefV8Context reference.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.HasException
member.summary: Returns true if the last method call resulted in an exception. This attribute exists only in the scope of the current CEF value object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetRethrowExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether this object will re-throw future exceptions. By default exceptions are not re-thrown. If a exception is re-thrown the current context should not be accessed again until after the exception has been caught and not re-thrown. Returns true on success. This attribute exists only in the scope of the current CEF value object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.HasValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the object has a value with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.HasValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the object has a value with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.DeleteValue(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only and don't-delete values this method will return true even though deletion failed.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.DeleteValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly, deletion fails or an exception is thrown. For read-only and don't-delete values this method will return true even though deletion failed.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value with the specified identifier on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value with the specified identifier on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.summary: Associates a value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only values this method will return true even though assignment failed.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetValue(System.Int32,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value)
member.summary: Associates a value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only values this method will return true even though assignment failed.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetValue(System.String,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8AccessControl,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8PropertyAttribute)
member.summary: Registers an identifier and returns true on success. Access to the identifier will be forwarded to the CefV8Accessor instance passed to CefV8Value::CreateObject(). Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only values this method will return true even though assignment failed.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.TryGetKeys(System.String[]@)
member.summary: Read the keys for the object's values into the specified vector. Integer- based keys will also be returned as strings.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetKeys
member.summary: Read the keys for the object's values into the specified vector. Integer- based keys will also be returned as strings.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetUserData(Xilium.CefGlue.CefUserData)
member.summary: Sets the user data for this object and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly. This method can only be called on user created objects.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetUserData
member.summary: Returns the user data, if any, assigned to this object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetExternallyAllocatedMemory
member.summary: Returns the amount of externally allocated memory registered for the object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.AdjustExternallyAllocatedMemory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the amount of registered external memory for the object. Used to give V8 an indication of the amount of externally allocated memory that is kept alive by JavaScript objects. V8 uses this information to decide when to perform global garbage collection. Each CefV8Value tracks the amount of external memory associated with it and automatically decreases the global total by the appropriate amount on its destruction. |change_in_bytes| specifies the number of bytes to adjust by. This method returns the number of bytes associated with the object after the adjustment. This method can only be called on user created objects.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetArrayLength
member.summary: ARRAY METHODS - These methods are only available on arrays. Returns the number of elements in the array.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetArrayBufferReleaseCallback
member.summary: ARRAY BUFFER METHODS - These methods are only available on ArrayBuffers. Returns the ReleaseCallback object associated with the ArrayBuffer or NULL if the ArrayBuffer was not created with CreateArrayBuffer.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.NeuterArrayBuffer
member.summary: Prevent the ArrayBuffer from using it's memory block by setting the length to zero. This operation cannot be undone. If the ArrayBuffer was created with CreateArrayBuffer then CefV8ArrayBufferReleaseCallback::ReleaseBuffer will be called to release the underlying buffer.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetFunctionName
member.summary: FUNCTION METHODS - These methods are only available on functions. Returns the function name.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetFunctionHandler
member.summary: Returns the function handler or NULL if not a CEF-created function.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.ExecuteFunction(Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value[])
member.summary: Execute the function using the current V8 context. This method should only be called from within the scope of a CefV8Handler or CefV8Accessor callback, or in combination with calling Enter() and Exit() on a stored CefV8Context reference. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the function. If |object| is empty the current context's global object will be used. |arguments| is the list of arguments that will be passed to the function. Returns the function return value on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.ExecuteFunctionWithContext(Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value[])
member.summary: Execute the function using the specified V8 context. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the function. If |object| is empty the specified context's global object will be used. |arguments| is the list of arguments that will be passed to the function. Returns the function return value on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue
member.summary: Class that wraps other data value types. Complex types (binary, dictionary and list) will be referenced but not owned by this object. Can be used on any process and thread.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.Create
member.summary: Creates a new object.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying data is valid. This will always be true for simple types. For complex types (binary, dictionary and list) the underlying data may become invalid if owned by another object (e.g. list or dictionary) and that other object is then modified or destroyed. This value object can be re-used by calling Set*() even if the underlying data is invalid.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsOwned
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying data is owned by another object.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying data is read-only. Some APIs may expose read-only objects.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsSame(Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue)
member.summary: Returns true if this object and |that| object have the same underlying data. If true modifications to this object will also affect |that| object and vice-versa.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsEqual(Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue)
member.summary: Returns true if this object and |that| object have an equivalent underlying value but are not necessarily the same object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.Copy
member.summary: Returns a copy of this object. The underlying data will also be copied.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetValueType
member.summary: Returns the underlying value type.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetBool
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type bool.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetInt
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type int.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetDouble
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type double.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetString
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type string.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetBinary
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type binary. The returned reference may become invalid if the value is owned by another object or if ownership is transferred to another object in the future. To maintain a reference to the value after assigning ownership to a dictionary or list pass this object to the SetValue() method instead of passing the returned reference to SetBinary().

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetDictionary
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type dictionary. The returned reference may become invalid if the value is owned by another object or if ownership is transferred to another object in the future. To maintain a reference to the value after assigning ownership to a dictionary or list pass this object to the SetValue() method instead of passing the returned reference to SetDictionary().

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.GetList
member.summary: Returns the underlying value as type list. The returned reference may become invalid if the value is owned by another object or if ownership is transferred to another object in the future. To maintain a reference to the value after assigning ownership to a dictionary or list pass this object to the SetValue() method instead of passing the returned reference to SetList().

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.SetNull
member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type null. Returns true if the value was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.SetBool(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type bool. Returns true if the value was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.SetInt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type int. Returns true if the value was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.SetDouble(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type double. Returns true if the value was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.SetString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type string. Returns true if the value was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.SetBinary(Xilium.CefGlue.CefBinaryValue)
member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type binary. Returns true if the value was set successfully. This object keeps a reference to |value| and ownership of the underlying data remains unchanged.

member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type dict. Returns true if the value was set successfully. This object keeps a reference to |value| and ownership of the underlying data remains unchanged.

member.summary: Sets the underlying value as type list. Returns true if the value was set successfully. This object keeps a reference to |value| and ownership of the underlying data remains unchanged.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefWebPluginInfoVisitor.Visit(Xilium.CefGlue.CefWebPluginInfo,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method that will be called once for each plugin. |count| is the 0-based index for the current plugin. |total| is the total number of plugins. Return false to stop visiting plugins. This method may never be called if no plugins are found.

member.summary: Interface to implement for receiving unstable plugin information. The methods of this class will be called on the browser process IO thread.

member.summary: Method that will be called for the requested plugin. |unstable| will be true if the plugin has reached the crash count threshold of 3 times in 120 seconds.

member.summary: Return true if this handler performs work like accessing the file system which may block. Used as a hint for determining the thread to access the handler from.

member.summary: Returns the subject of the X.509 certificate. For HTTPS server certificates this represents the web server. The common name of the subject should match the host name of the web server.

member.summary: Returns the issuer of the X.509 certificate.

member.summary: Returns the date before which the X.509 certificate is invalid. CefTime.GetTimeT() will return 0 if no date was specified.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefX509Certificate.GetValidExpiry
member.summary: Returns the date after which the X.509 certificate is invalid. CefTime.GetTimeT() will return 0 if no date was specified.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefX509Certificate.GetPemEncoded
member.summary: Returns the PEM encoded data for the X.509 certificate.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefX509Certificate.GetIssuerChainSize
member.summary: Returns the number of certificates in the issuer chain. If 0, the certificate is self-signed.

member.summary: Returns the DER encoded data for the certificate issuer chain. If we failed to encode a certificate in the chain it is still present in the array but is an empty string.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefX509Certificate.GetPEMEncodedIssuerChain(System.Int64@,Xilium.CefGlue.CefBinaryValue@)

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader
member.summary: Class that supports the reading of XML data via the libxml streaming API. The methods of this class should only be called on the thread that creates the object.

member.summary: Create a new CefXmlReader object. The returned object's methods can only be called from the thread that created the object.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToNextNode
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the next node in the document. This method must be called at least once to set the current cursor position. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Close
member.summary: Close the document. This should be called directly to ensure that cleanup occurs on the correct thread.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.HasError
member.summary: Returns true if an error has been reported by the XML parser.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Error
member.summary: Returns the error string.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.NodeType
member.summary: The below methods retrieve data for the node at the current cursor position. Returns the node type.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Depth
member.summary: Returns the node depth. Depth starts at 0 for the root node.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.LocalName
member.summary: Returns the local name. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/#NT-LocalPart for additional details.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Prefix
member.summary: Returns the namespace prefix. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/ for additional details.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.QualifiedName
member.summary: Returns the qualified name, equal to (Prefix:)LocalName. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/#ns-qualnames for additional details.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.NamespaceUri
member.summary: Returns the URI defining the namespace associated with the node. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/ for additional details.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.BaseUri
member.summary: Returns the base URI of the node. See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for additional details.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.XmlLang
member.summary: Returns the xml:lang scope within which the node resides. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/#sec-lang-tag for additional details.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: Returns true if the node represents an empty element. is considered empty but is not.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.HasValue
member.summary: Returns true if the node has a text value.

member.name: P:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Value
member.summary: Returns the text value.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attribute nodes are not traversed by default. The below methods can be used to move the cursor to an attribute node. MoveToCarryingElement() can be called afterwards to return the cursor to the carrying element. The depth of an attribute node will be 1 + the depth of the carrying element. Moves the cursor to the attribute at the specified 0-based index. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String)

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the first attribute in the current element. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the next attribute in the current element. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToCarryingElement
member.summary: Moves the cursor back to the carrying element. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation
member.summary: CEF offers two context safety implementations with different performance characteristics.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation.SafeDefault
member.summary: The default implementation (value of 0) uses a map of hash values and should provide better performance in situations with a small number contexts.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation.SafeAlternate
member.summary: The alternate implementation (value of 1) uses a hidden value attached to each context and should provide better performance in situations with a large number of contexts.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation.Disabled
member.summary: If you need better performance in the creation of V8 references and you plan to manually track context lifespan you can disable context safety by specifying a value of -1.

member.summary: This option instructs the writer to write doubles that have no fractional part as a normal integer (i.e., without using exponential notation or appending a '.0') as long as the value is within the range of a 64-bit int.

member.name: T:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy
member.summary: Policy for how the Referrer HTTP header value will be sent during navigation. If the `--no-referrers` command-line flag is specified then the policy value will be ignored and the Referrer value will never be sent. Must be kept synchronized with net::URLRequest::ReferrerPolicy from Chromium.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.ClearReferrerOnTransitionFromSecureToInsecure
member.summary: Clear the referrer header if the header value is HTTPS but the request destination is HTTP. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.Default
member.summary: Default policy (same as CLEAR_REFERRER_ON_TRANSITION_FROM_SECURE_TO_INSECURE).

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.ReduceReferrerGranularityOnTransitionCrossOrigin
member.summary: A slight variant on CLEAR_REFERRER_ON_TRANSITION_FROM_SECURE_TO_INSECURE: If the request destination is HTTP, an HTTPS referrer will be cleared. If the request's destination is cross-origin with the referrer (but does not downgrade), the referrer's granularity will be stripped down to an origin rather than a full URL. Same-origin requests will send the full referrer.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.OriginOnlyOnTransitionCrossOrigin
member.summary: Strip the referrer down to an origin when the origin of the referrer is different from the destination's origin.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.NeverClearReferrer
member.summary: Never change the referrer.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.Origin
member.summary: Strip the referrer down to the origin regardless of the redirect location.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.ClearReferrerOnTransitionCrossOrigin
member.summary: Clear the referrer when the request's referrer is cross-origin with the request's destination.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.OriginClearOnTransitionFromSecureToInsecure
member.summary: Strip the referrer down to the origin, but clear it entirely if the referrer value is HTTPS and the destination is HTTP.

member.name: F:Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.NoReferrer
member.summary: Always clear the referrer regardless of the request destination.
